document_data.mainbody: '''The Splendid Order of Armorers, Locksmiths, and Finesmiths''' was a guild in [[Waterdeep]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]]. It convened at the [[Metal House of Wonders]].
document_data.Organization:
The Splendid Order's membership was reserved only for the most skilled, talented, and renowned smiths of [[armor]], [[shield]]s, [[weapon]]s, [[locks]], metal sculptures, [[mask]]s, wire-jewelry, metal plating for party costumes, decorative metal [[bird]]s, and other items of "finest quality" sought after by [[mage]]s who weaved magical [[enchantment]]s into them. The members of the guild were allowed to set the highest fees for their service and custom orders of vaults and special locks placed by wealthy [[adventurer]]s and nobles. Another business exclusive to the members of the Splendid Order was the creation of fashion signet [[ring]]s for the nobles and the [[Lords of Waterdeep]], while guild stamps were made for the Waterdhavian guilds.

The guild's uniform consisted of a gray [[cloak]] held in place by a blue star broch on the left shoulder. Membership dues were two [[gold]] [[coin|pieces]] per month, and a one-time entrance fee to the Metal House of Wonders cost thirty-five [[gp]]. Each guild member trained a group of apprentices for many years at a time.
document_data.Base of Operations: The Splendid Order of Armorers, Locksmiths, and Finesmiths operated out of the Metal House of Wonders located along [[Belnimbra's Street]] and [[Gut Alley]] in the [[Waterdeep/Dock Ward|Dock Ward]] of Waterdeep.
document_data.History: Around the 1370's [[DR]], High Seeker [[Jhoadil Zulthind]] of the [[Church of Gond]] partnered with this and other guilds in the city to begin actively marketing [[construct]]s to the wealthiest residents of Waterdeep. During the same period of time, the scions of the noble [[Amcathra]] house were among active patrons of the Splendid Order.<ref>
document_data.Notable Members:
*[[Avi]], a [[genasi]] expert armorsmith in the late 15{{th}} century DR. 
*[[Hallthor Duzmund]], a [[fighter]], Master Smith, and the guildmaster in the mid–14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Roysark Cuthbarrel]], the guildmaster in the late 15 {{th}} century DR.
